para.text: This pane is a subpane of the
Farm well flow rates can be treated in one of the following ways.

li.text: will treat the flows as other flow terms are. ModelMuse sets this in
The farm process also allows the farm well flows to be printed to a text file named "FWELLS.OUT."

para.text: The net recharge simulated by the Farm process can be treated in one of the following ways.

li.text: will treat the flows as other flow terms are. ModelMuse sets this in
An array of farm net recharge rates for each cell for each time step is saved in a text file named

li.text: farm net recharge rates is saved in a text file named

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: “FNRCH_LIST.OUT” along with the stress period, time step, total time, and farm ID.

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: farm net recharge rates is saved in a binary file named

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: FNRCH_LIST_BIN.OUT” along with the stress period, time step, total time, and farm ID.
will treat the flows as other flow terms are. ModelMuse sets this in
dialog box except that if the data is saved as a binary file, it will be saved in a file with the extension .FDS_BIN instead of the .cbc file.

A list (A) of current demand and supply flow rates will be printed to the list file at each iteration, and a list (B) of final demand and supply flow rates will be printed to the list file for each time step

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: A list of final demand and supply flow rates will be printed to the list file for each time step:

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: A list of initial demand and supply flow rates and of final demand & supply flow rates after the application of a deficiency scenario will be saved on ASCII file “FDS.OUT” for all time steps:

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;
